intro: Cynometra schlechteri, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Its bark is thick and fissured, and it can grow up to 25 meters tall. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
